content.newsInsight: China just unveiled the world's largest green energy grid while everyone else debates climate targets. Not a moonshot. A market capture. When you control 80% of solar manufacturing and build the infrastructure to use it, that's not environmentalism. That's economic warfare with better PR.
content.patternInsight: You're still reading. That already puts you ahead.
content.intelligenceExample: China's green energy dominance, for example. We read that and our mind goes to: if fossil fuels are the past and China owns the future's supply chain, which Western companies are secretly building parallel capacity right now?
content.consultingInsight: We were just reading how McKinsey's latest sustainability practice helps Fortune 500s navigate the energy transition with proprietary carbon modeling tools. Absolutely brilliant work, years of data refinement. But what if that level of strategic foresight wasn't limited to companies with eight figure consulting budgets?
